presentation.title: Mastering API Governance with Insights, Interfaces, and Nudging
presentation.toc: API Governance becomes increasingly challenging with increasing organizational size: How to best balance the needs of faster and more agile ways of developing products with the overarching needs of the organization? The first pillar of API Governance are insights: In order to understand where the API landscape is moving, it is important to understand what it looks like. APIs take the radical stance of making implementations opaque, which means that the only truly API-compatible way of gaining insights into an API landscape is through its APIs. The second pillar of API Governance are interfaces: Enterprise architecture often mixes concerns of what to build, and how to build it. APIs are a departure from this model by saying that how things are built is of no concern to a capability's user, but that what is being built can make a big difference in terms of how APIs are discovered and used. The third pillar of API Governance is nudging: The most effective way to evolve API landscapes is when teams make all the right design and implementation decisions (from the organization's point of view) by themselves. By helping teams with support and tooling, platform teams have great influence on what teams perceive as the best way to design and build their products. Using these three pillars of API governance, enterprise architects and platform teams can have a substantial and productive influence on an organization's API landscape. In this session we discuss issues such as how to create and manage API guidelines, and how to establish and execute an API program.
